summary: The Working Waterfront Disaster Mitigation Tax Credit Act proposes to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a tax credit for hazard mitigation projects on working waterfront property. The credit is equal to 30 percent of the qualified investment, up to $300,000, and is available for projects designed to prevent or mitigate damage from natural disasters.  Eligible projects include structural elevation, flood risk reduction, shoreline stabilization, floodproofing, retrofitting, and warning systems. The bill also includes provisions for inflation adjustments, limitations, and effective dates.
